alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:20AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Allegheny River At Mosgrove affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At CW Bill Young Dam affecting Allegheny County. Allegheny River At Kittanning affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At Natrona affecting Allegheny and Westmoreland Counties.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-129-190330- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.W.0015.220219T1030Z-220220T0000Z/ /NATP1.1.ER.220219T1030Z.220219T1200Z.220219T1800Z.NO/ 1020 AM EST Fri Feb 18 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River at Natrona. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 21.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 14.3 feet and begin rising again Tuesday morning. It will rise to 14.4 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall to 14.3 feet and begin rising again early Wednesday morning. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
